千利休の茶会の時、黄金色の饅頭が出された。

sen.j: この饅頭を利休が大変気に入り、それ以来利休の茶会には必ずこの饅頭が出されたという。
sen.e: It is said that Rikyu liked this manju very much, and since then this manju was always served at the tea ceremonies held by Rikyu.

sen.j: 三重県伊勢市
由来
明治の初め、伊勢国の茶道達が千家の宗匠を招き、大神宮献茶会を催した。
sen.e: At the beginning of Meiji era, tea masters in Ise Province held a tea ceremony exhibition at Ise-jingu Shrine inviting the sojo (headmaster) of Sen family.
At the beginning of the Meiji era, tea masters in Ise Province held a tea ceremony exhibition at Ise-jingu Shrine inviting the sojo (headmaster) of the Sen family.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Meiji era, tea masters in Ise Province held a tea ceremony exhibition at Ise-jingu Shrine inviting the sojo (headmaster) of the Sen family.

sen.j: そのとき、藤屋窓月堂の初代藤波五左衛門が宗匠好みの饅頭をつくり、お茶の伴に用いた。
sen.e: At that time, Gozaemon FUJINAMI, the founder of Fujiya Sogetsudo, prepared sojo's favorite manju and provided it for the tea ceremony.
At that time, Gozaemon FUJINAMI, the founder of Fujiya Sogetsudo, prepared sojo's favorite manju and provided it for the tea ceremony.
At that time, Gozaemon FUJINAMI, the founder of Fujiya Sogetsudo, prepared sojo's favorite manju and provided it for the tea ceremony.

sen.j: 宗匠は、その床しき風味に感じ「利休饅頭」と付けた。
sen.e: Sojo was impressed by its refined taste and named it "Rikyu manju".
The sojo was impressed by its refined taste and named it "Rikyu manju".
sen.cmt: sojoに定冠詞を付けました。
sen.e: The sojo was impressed by its refined taste and named it "Rikyu manju".

sen.j: 特徴
紅白と抹茶の3種類あり、紅は小豆こし餡、白はうずら豆こし餡を使用している。
sen.e: There three types of product, namely red-colored products, white-colored products and maccha products (the ones with powdered green tea added), and azuki bean koshian is used for red-colored products while pinto bean koshian is used for white-colored products.

There are three types of products, namely red products, white products and maccha products (the ones with powdered green tea added), and azuki bean koshian is used for red products while pinto bean koshian is used for white products.

sen.e: There are three types of products, namely red products, white products and maccha products (the ones with powdered green tea added), and azuki bean koshian is used for red products while pinto bean koshian is used for white products.

sen.j: 抹茶は皮に抹茶をいれ紅と同じ餡を使用している。
sen.e: In the case of maccha products, red tea is added to a wrapping of dough and the same bean paste with red-colored products is used.
In case of maccha products, red tea is added to the wrapping of dough and the same bean paste with red products is used.
In case of maccha products, red tea is added to the wrapping of dough and the same bean paste with red products is used.

sen.j: 抹茶は彼岸とお盆の期間限定で販売されている（ある程度の数量を頼めば彼岸とお盆以外の時期でも受注生産してくれる）。
sen.e: Maccha products are on sale only during the period of higan (equinox) and obon festival (available in other period than higan and obon festival by ordering more than a certain number).
Maccha products are on sale only during the period of higan (equinox) and obon festivals (available in other periods than the higan and obon festivals by ordering a certain quantity of products).

sen.e: Maccha products are on sale only during the period of higan (equinox) and obon festivals (available in other periods than the higan and obon festivals by ordering a certain quantity of products).

sen.j: 最初は、白いものだけだったが、慶事に使えるように、皮をうす紅に染め、小豆の漉し餡をいれたものを創った。
sen.e: Though only white-colored products were produced originally, products which has light-red colored wrapping of dough and use azuki bean koshian were developed later for the purpose of the gifts of auspicious events.

sen.j: 島根県浜田市・大田市
由来
千利休（茶聖）→古田重然公（茶人）→初代浜田城主古田重治公家（重治は重然の甥）→仲屋の家祖治右衛門と伝えられた。
sen.e: It was inherited from SEN no RIKYU (chasei) => Shigenari FURUTA (master of tea ceremony) => Shigeharu FURUTA (Shigeharu is a nephew of Shigenari), the first lord of Hamada-jo castle => Jiemon, the founder of Nakaya.

It is a café in Bali island which serves Japanese cakes.
It is a café in Bali island which serves Japanese cakes.

sen.j: 利休饅頭もある。
利休饅頭を描いた落語
sen.e: Rikyu manju appearing in Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling)
Rikyu manju appearing in Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling)
Rikyu manju appearing in Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling)

sen.j: 落語家、三遊亭圓窓の圓窓五百噺の中の一つ、「茶の湯」に「利休饅頭」が登場するが、非常にまずい饅頭として語られる。
sen.e: "Rikyu manju" appears in "Chanoyu", one of Enso Gohyaku Banashi (500 rakugo-stories of Enso) of rakugo storyteller Sanyutei Enso, as a very unpalatable manju.
"Rikyu manju" appears as a very unpalatable manju in "Chanoyu", one of Enso Gohyaku Banashi (500 rakugo-stories of Enso) of rakugo storyteller Sanyutei Enso.
"Rikyu manju" appears as a very unpalatable manju in "Chanoyu", one of Enso Gohyaku Banashi (500 rakugo-stories of Enso) of rakugo storyteller Sanyutei Enso.

sen.j: 根岸 (台東区)に住むある隠居が、近所の者を集めて茶会を催していた。
sen.e: A retired person who resided at Negishi (Taito Ward) used to invite neighbors and hold tea ceremony.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: A retired person who lived in Negishi (Taito Ward) used to invite neighbors to tea ceremonies.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更し、単数形を複数形にしました。
sen.e: A retired person who lived in Negishi (Taito Ward) used to invite neighbors to tea ceremonies.

sen.j: お茶がひどいものでとても飲めた代物ではなかったため、お客は上等なお菓子のみを目当てにしてきていた。
sen.e: As the tea served by him was quite nasty and undrinkable, guests gathered for excellent cakes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As the tea served by him was very bad and undrinkable, guests came with the aim of eating delicious cakes.
As the tea served by him was very bad and undrinkable, guests came with the aim of eating delicious cakes.

sen.j: やがて、隠居は菓子屋への支払いがバカにならないと思い、菓子を自作することにする。
sen.e: Before long, a retired person realized that the payment to a cake shop was not negligible and started to produce cakes by himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Before long, the retired person realized that the payment to a cake shop was not negligible and started to produce cakes by himself.
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞を定冠詞にしました。
sen.e: Before long, the retired person realized that the payment to a cake shop was not negligible and started to produce cakes by himself.

sen.j: しかし、芋を原料にした饅頭のようなものだったため、ひどい味だった。
sen.e: However, it was very unpalatable since it was a manju-like cake made of sweet potato.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, they were very unpalatable since they were manju-like cakes made from sweet potato.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更し、単数形を複数形にしました。
sen.e: However, they were very unpalatable since they were manju-like cakes made from sweet potato.

sen.j: 隠居は、この饅頭もどきを「利休饅頭」と洒落た名前を付けた。
sen.e: A retired person gave a smart name of "Rikyu manju" to the above manju-like cake.
The retired person gave a smart name of "Rikyu manju" to the manju-like cakes.
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞を定冠詞にしました。
sen.e: The retired person gave a smart name of "Rikyu manju" to the manju-like cakes.

sen.j: その後、初めて招いたお客に例のまずいお茶と利休饅頭を出した。
sen.e: He served the nasty tea mentioned above and "Rikyu manju" to the first guest he invited after that.
He served the bad tea and "Rikyu manju" to the first guest he invited after that.
He served the bad tea and "Rikyu manju" to the first guest he invited after that.

sen.j: お客はお茶がまずかったため、利休饅頭を口にする。
sen.e: The guest ate Rikyu manju because the tea was nasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The guest ate Rikyu manju because the tea tasted bad.
The guest ate Rikyu manju because the tea tasted bad.

sen.j: しかし、これもまずかったため、厠に行くふりをして、この饅頭もどきを外に投げ捨てた。
sen.e: However, it was also so unpalatable that he threw this manju-like cake out while pretending to go to the restroom.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, it was also so unpalatable that he pretended to go to the restroom and threw the manju-like cake out.
However, it was also so unpalatable that he pretended to go to the restroom and threw the manju-like cake out.

sen.j: この投げ捨てられた饅頭が畑で働いていた百姓の顔にあたり、百姓は汚れを取りながら、「また、茶の湯、やってんなァ」とつぶやく、という噺。
sen.e: This manju hit the face of a farmer who was working in the field, and a farmer murmured, while cleaning up his face, "He is holding chanoyu (a tea ceremony) again".
The manju hit the face of a farmer who was working in the field, and the farmer murmured, while cleaning up his face, "He is holding chanoyu (a tea ceremony) again".
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞を定冠詞にしました。
sen.e: The manju hit the face of a farmer who was working in the field, and the farmer murmured, while cleaning up his face, "He is holding chanoyu (a tea ceremony) again".

sen.j: また、三遊亭金馬 (4代目)も演目としてこの「茶の湯」を行っているが、細部が異なっている。
sen.e: Sanyutei Kinba (the fourth) also used "Chanoyu" as his program, but the details are different.
Sanyutei Kinba (the fourth) also used "Chanoyu" as one of his programs, but the details are different.
Sanyutei Kinba (the fourth) also used "Chanoyu" as one of his programs, but the details are different.

sen.j: その他
旅館等で温物として出されたり、料理学校などで和菓子の作り方で題材にされることがある。
sen.e: Rikyu manju is sometimes served as onmono(hot dish) at Japanese inns or selected by cooking schools as a theme for learning how to make Japanese cakes.
Rikyu manju is sometimes served as onmono (hot dish) at Japanese inns or selected by cooking schools as a theme for learning how to make Japanese cakes.
sen.cmt: スペースが足りないので追加しました。
sen.e: Rikyu manju is sometimes served as onmono (hot dish) at Japanese inns or selected by cooking schools as a theme for learning how to make Japanese cakes.

sen.j: また、糖尿病の人でも食べられる低カロリー和菓子の利休饅頭もある。
sen.e: Low-calorie Rikyu manju which even people with diabetes can eat is also on sale.
Low-calorie Rikyu manju which even people with diabetes can eat is also on sale.
Low-calorie Rikyu manju which even people with diabetes can eat is also on sale.

sen.j: 変わった食べ方としては、小麦粉を薄く溶いてその中に饅頭を泳がせて揚げるという方法がある。
sen.e: The unusual way of eating Rikyu manju is to eat it after dipping in a flour-and-water batter and frying.
The unusual way of eating Rikyu manju is to eat it after dipping in a flour-and-water batter and frying.
The unusual way of eating Rikyu manju is to eat it after dipping in a flour-and-water batter and frying.
